description: From Latin lenis (“soft, mild”) + -fy. Compare French lénifier. See lenition.

verbs.description: lenify (third-person singular simple present lenifies, present participle lenifying, simple past and past participle lenified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To assuage or mitigate; to soften.
examples: These first infused, to lenify the pain He tugs with pincers, but he tugs in vain
